posts.title: FDA says it will phase out petroleum-based food dyes, authorize four natural color additives
top_comments: But they can’t be fucked to enforce food safety regulations?
[deleted]

From a doctor, the issue with this is the HUGE amount of energy and effort being put into this (there’s no good evidence that the amount of dye used here causes any problems other than in pitri dish studies/feeding gallons to mice) and a COMPLETE disregard for things that are ACTIVELY harming people (food safety monitoring, lead, vaccine hesitancy, cost of healthy food, more strict regulations on air and water quality).

This is the medical equivalent of giving emergency chamomile tea to someone with insomnia…who also has a gaping gunshot wound to their leg.

Any country that wants to export food products needs to meet the market’s food safety standards or the products will only be good for domestic use.  Other countries don’t need or want bright red fruit loops and blue icing and neon orange cheese dust. 

Some of these dyes have been banned for a decade in other countries - no one misses them one bit - and large companies have pivoted away from them without going broke.   It rarely changes the formulation or production of a product.   

It’s a super simple change.  The only thing party that loses here are the companies that make the petroleum based dyes.  Which will be replaced by companies that make non petroleum based dyes.  Who owns those?

I think a lot of the fears about some food dyes are overhyped and at worst fear mongering, but I do believe if natural color additives can be used they should be. Doing things because they're cheaper or easier doesn't mean it should be that way. Natural dyes work just fine. I think it would make people in all areas of the conversation come to agreement.
Plot twist: no one will be around at the FDA to test products for compliance
These natural colors wouldn’t happen to be Colloidal Silver, Monoatomic Gold, Copper and Spirulina would they?
Why is medicine loaded up with dyes? I have no fucks to give about the color of medicine, only that the stuff is effective.
But let’s not check milk for safety anymore!!!!
They can't test milk but they they'll be able to regulate and enforce this? Ya sure, totes.

posts.title: Bill Owens, Executive Producer Of ’60 Minutes,’ Resigns, Saying He Lost His Ability To Make “Independent Decisions” About The Show
top_comments:
*Owens’ departure comes amid settlement talks between CBS and Donald Trump‘s team over a lawsuit Trump filed over the way 60 Minutes edited an interview with Kamala Harris. Many legal observers call the lawsuit frivolous, but CBS’ parent company, Paramount Global, needs administration approval for its proposed merger with Skydance. A mediator was recently selected to try to resolve the dispute, sources said.*

Well, that's pretty clear.

Just a reminder, [CBS is currently in the process of a merger with Skydance Media](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/08/media/paramount-global-skydance-merger-announcement/index.html) and is awaiting [FCC](https://www.fcc.gov/transaction/skydance-paramount) approval. 

Trump is currently suing CBS over [60 Minutes](https://apnews.com/article/cbs-60-minutes-lawsuit-trump-pelley-58339cc1a1eb52739bb365e2e8c6d8bc). A settlement that will need to be settled before the merger is approved.

posts.title: Gaza health ministry denies manipulating death toll figures
top_comments:
Fine, let's go with the death toll figures quoted by external agencies like Lancet.

lbr if anything it's much higher. they went after the hospitals and infrastructure first so it couldn't be accurately counted.

you can't bomb a small territory for 2 years while destroying hospital and not allowing in aid or food and think that the death toll isn't higher.

The US and Isreal have both accepted health ministry numbers for years.  Its only recently that the US media has started trying to besmirch the numbers by referring to it as the "Hamas-lead."

Anything to avoid responsibility for genocide.

Seriously? Looking at the wholesale destruction and at where the IDF has launched missile strikes, including at clearly marked aid and medical convoys (UN, even),  does the Gaza Health Ministry really need to inflate the number of dead women and children?

Like we're not still talking about tens of thousands of murders? When innocent people are killed it's called murder. When babies are blown to bits daily, it's murder. Twenty thousand, fifty thousand, what's the fucking difference they're arguing here? I hope every single person responsible dies a painful death. Absolutely breaks my heart to see the horror these people endure every day for people to argue, well not THAT many of em were killed. Give me a fucking break.

"At least 51,266 people have been killed in the 18 months since the Gaza war began, according to the Hamas-run Ministry of Health, with nearly a third of the dead aged under 18."

posts.title: Lori Vallow Daybell jury returns guilty verdict in Arizona trial over Charles Vallow's death
top_comments:
22 April 2025

from the article:

>Lori Vallow Daybell was convicted Tuesday of conspiracy to commit murder in the 2019 killing of her estranged husband in Arizona:

>Daybell is already serving life sentences in Idaho for multiple murders and for conspiracy to commit murder.

>Jurors deliberated for a total of three hours over two days. 

>During the trial, which began in Phoenix on March 31, prosecutors argued that Vallow Daybell and Cox had planned to kill Vallow so she could collect money from his life insurance policy and marry Daybell, an Idaho author who wrote several religious novels about prophecies and the end of the world.

>"What we see is a very planned out, premeditated murder," prosecutor Treena Kay told the jury in her closing argument.

>Vallow Daybell represented herself at the trial despite not being a lawyer. She didn't call any witnesses or put on any evidence in her defense, but said in her opening and closing statements that Vallow's death wasn't a crime.

>This trial was not Vallow Daybell's last. She is scheduled to go on trial again in early June on a charge of conspiring to murder Brandon Boudreaux, the ex-husband of her niece, Melani Pawlowski.

*... prosecutors argued that Vallow Daybell and Cox had planned to kill Vallow so she could collect money from his life insurance policy and marry Daybell, an Idaho author who wrote several religious novels about prophecies and the end of the world.*

I knew that cult indications had to come up at some point in this story.

Her son Colby live streamed the verdict and broke down in tears. I’m honestly amazed by his strength and how he is rather grounded with a good head on his shoulders. He’s definitely not giving up. I can’t imagine being in his shoes. Lori is a fucking monster and even looks like a haggard demon.

>Cox's account was later called into question and Vallow Daybell was charged in Vallow's death following other murders, including of her children, 16-year-old Tylee Ryan and 7-year-old Joshua "JJ" Vallow. Vallow Daybell is already [serving life sentences in Idaho](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/lori-vallow-daybell-doomsday-mom-trial-tylee-ryan-jj-vallow-what-to-know/) for those murders and conspiring to murder her then-boyfriend [Chad Daybell's](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/chad-daybell-trial-doomsday-cult-murder-case/) wife, Tammy.

Holy fuck, no matter how many times I read that, I cannot make heads nor tails of it. Everyone is named either "Vallow" or "Daybell". I think it's saying she's serving life in Idaho for killing a couple of her kids, but the rest... 🤷 Anyone out there on the interwebs able to translate this for me?
For anybody that really wants to dig into this crazy ass story, I recommend this podcast: https://youtu.be/iT4e3gRlQr8?si=DcYYiQMbsQUIc8o0
Good. It still pisses me off that she didn't get the death penalty too because she fucking deserves it. If not for her those 4 people wouldn't be dead.
how many people has this crazy person tried to kill??? damn
Gonna see this on Snapped right quick.
Can't wait for the lpotl side stories discussion on this.
FYI there's a documentary on Netflix about this called Sins of Our Mother.

posts.title: FDA says it will phase out petroleum-based food dyes, authorize four natural color additives
top_comments: But they can’t be fucked to enforce food safety regulations?
[deleted]

From a doctor, the issue with this is the HUGE amount of energy and effort being put into this (there’s no good evidence that the amount of dye used here causes any problems other than in pitri dish studies/feeding gallons to mice) and a COMPLETE disregard for things that are ACTIVELY harming people (food safety monitoring, lead, vaccine hesitancy, cost of healthy food, more strict regulations on air and water quality).

This is the medical equivalent of giving emergency chamomile tea to someone with insomnia…who also has a gaping gunshot wound to their leg.

Any country that wants to export food products needs to meet the market’s food safety standards or the products will only be good for domestic use.  Other countries don’t need or want bright red fruit loops and blue icing and neon orange cheese dust. 

Some of these dyes have been banned for a decade in other countries - no one misses them one bit - and large companies have pivoted away from them without going broke.   It rarely changes the formulation or production of a product.   

It’s a super simple change.  The only thing party that loses here are the companies that make the petroleum based dyes.  Which will be replaced by companies that make non petroleum based dyes.  Who owns those?

I think a lot of the fears about some food dyes are overhyped and at worst fear mongering, but I do believe if natural color additives can be used they should be. Doing things because they're cheaper or easier doesn't mean it should be that way. Natural dyes work just fine. I think it would make people in all areas of the conversation come to agreement.
Plot twist: no one will be around at the FDA to test products for compliance
These natural colors wouldn’t happen to be Colloidal Silver, Monoatomic Gold, Copper and Spirulina would they?
Why is medicine loaded up with dyes? I have no fucks to give about the color of medicine, only that the stuff is effective.
But let’s not check milk for safety anymore!!!!
They can't test milk but they they'll be able to regulate and enforce this? Ya sure, totes.
